file_content.text: About the whole "Great Hunt" thing.... Thanks. It'd mean a lot to Braden that you stuck with it.
I didn't do this as a favor to anyone.
This was my victory.
Cool your engines, nobody's trying to steal your trophy or anything.
The least I could do for the old man was win this thing.
Figured I owed him.
Thought it might mean something to you, too.
[Flirt] This was for you.
That's really... sweet. Probably untrue, but sweet. Thanks.
I think Braden would say that I didn't win this without your help.
He'd be proud of us both.
You don't have to tell me how awesome I am: I already know. It's my moment of humility, just run with it, okay?
This is my hunt. It's what I was born to do.
This isn't a favor.
Just like the old man.
Figure I ought to at least finish this for the old man.
Don't mention it.
Thanks. Already said that, didn't I?
We'll win this thing and avenge Braden. Just stick with me.
We'll make him proud.
I'm not going anywhere.
I'm in this for your sake more than his.
[Flirt] What's it mean to you?
That's sweet in a "total and complete lie" kind of way.
Great Hunt was Braden's dream. Talked about it for years. Day he told me he'd found you...
Should've seen him. Grinning and laughing so much I thought his face would split in half.
It's not exactly every day you get a shot at the Great Hunt.
I was lucky he found me.
Laughing doesn't sound like something he did much of.
Are you sure it was Braden?
Thought maybe he'd gone crazy.
Winning this thing... it would've meant more to him than revenge.
So... I'm going to skip saying "Thank you" again, because you get the idea already. Let's just get moving.
Great. Can we get to work now?
Right. Never mind, then.
You know what? You're okay.
"Okay" is for amateurs.
I'm a pro.
No, I mean...
Suppose I could do worse than that.
Thanks.
Hey, from me, that's the highest praise.
That's what I've been trying to tell you.
[Flirt] You just notice that?
Sort of egotistical, but still okay.
I'm glad to have you around, Mako.
You're okay, too.
When Braden first talked about you, I don't know what I expected, but whatever it was, you're better.
What I want to say is: You're awesome, and if you were lost in the same sector, I would definitely give you directions.
I'll keep that in mind.
Good to know.
Can't argue with that kind of thinking.
I am pretty awesome.
And if someone put a bounty on your head, I'd shoot them for you.
I'd do the same for you.
You wouldn't collect on it, first? That's really sweet of you!
All right, anyway, you get the point. Let's get back to work.
It's strange. I haven't always known you. It just doesn't seem possible.
It's gotten hard to remember what life was like before we met.
Don't waste time on it. Now is what's important.
The past doesn't matter.
Must've been pretty bad. Better not to think about, really.
How did you live without me?
Yeah. Pretty traumatic, all the years I spent without your ego.
I know what you mean.
I understand.
I love you, you know. You probably guessed that already.
You don't have to tell me.
I know.
Yeah, but I feel slightly better for saying it out loud.
This the part where things get mushy?
What happens now?
No, this is probably where Blizz runs over, chased by ten angry droids.
Probably this is where Torian wanders over and asks what we're doing.
Want me to say it, for you? I love you.
I love you, too.
Man, I wish I'd gotten a holo recording of that.
Let's make this an official contract. What do you say?
Marry me.
When you put it that way, how can a girl possibly say no?
Scale of one to ten, how much do you think you want to get married?
What do you think of weddings?
If you're asking? Ten. If it's Gault: negative fifty.
Just one to ten scale? That's not nearly good enough. Got to go at least to fifty...
We've got to get back to work soon.
Enjoy this while it lasts.
Mister Romance strikes again. I suppose we should get to work, huh?
Hey, I was scanning the holonet and lost track of time.
Where is everybody? It's so quiet, I thought for a second I'd gotten on the wrong ship.
We've got plenty of work to do. They should be busy.
Out and about.
Then let's not waste our chance to be alone.
I can think of at least one good use for an empty ship...
[Flirt] Good opportunity.
Oh really?
Sounds about perfect, doesn't it?
[Flirt] So, it's just us...
You might be on to something there.
You know, I could get used to this. Peace, quiet, total lack of Gault...
Okay, admit it: You pitched the guys out an air lock. It's okay. I won't judge. This time, anyway.
Hey, got a minute? I wanted to talk to you.
I just wanted to say... thanks. For the Coral thing. You didn't have to do all that.
I did it for you.
Yes I did.
I might, this once, accept payment in kisses.
[Flirt] How grateful are you?
You can't go around saying stuff like that! We've got a business contract here, stay professional!
You don't feel just a little bit unprofessional?
You still want to be friends?
It's not about what I feel! We've got work...
Anyone who tells me you can't mix business and pleasure is looking to get shot.
We can work, too.
How can I argue with that? You're like some kind of romantic genius.
Guess we'll have to stop working together.
[Kiss her] You're fired.
Stop pretending. It'll be okay. Trust me.
You don't mean that.
Okay, so all that stuff I said before? The whole not mixing work and whatever? I've officially changed my mind.
Mind holding my hand while I do something stupid?
Feel like watching my back through another scary holocall? I survived the last one, but this... might just get me.
Remember that datapad we got from Carteri about a million years ago? I cracked it.
I got a holo frequency for Izak. Mister Project 32 himself. I can't... do this without you.
Let's see this guy.
Make the call.
Want to take bets on whether he's ten meters tall and breathes fire? Right. Quit stalling, Mako...
That's what I'm here for, stopping angry looks from strangers.
Deadly holocalls. My favorite.
Perfect! Just sort of stand there and look imposing. Pretty much like you always do.
There's no way he'll answer questions for you.
He's not going to talk.
That's what you're here for. I thought having the biggest bounty hunter in the galaxy backing me up might help.
What's this?
Okay, before we get started, let's set something straight: My name is Mako. M-A-K-O. Got it?
Call me "Coral" and so help me, I will find a way to punch you through the holonet.
Mako? Now that's a name I never thought I'd hear again.
We want answers. Start talking.
This isn't a social call.
Believe me, I would love to talk to Mako. I've got plenty of questions, myself.
It's like a family reunion with your long-lost SIS goon.
That's adorable, Mako.
Yeah, I've got all kinds of warm fuzzies right now.
You're the first person who didn't insist she was Coral.
You know who she is?
I can imagine. Mako's been presumed dead for twenty years. No one was expecting her to turn up now.
Unfortunately for both of us, I don't have much time for conversation at the moment.
Think it might be in your best interest to talk sooner, rather than later.
Make time.
Normally, I'd agree with you on that.
Funny how you just happen to be on your way out.
What a coincidence.
You did manage to get me at a bad time.
You got something better to do?
Why not?
My team has pinpointed Coral's location. Finding her is my priority.
Mako, a word of warning: This isn't the life you want. Whatever happens, stay away from Coral.
Why? What do you want with her? What did she do?
She's killed most of the people involved in Project 32.
I can only assume she'll try to kill you, too. She's gotten almost everyone else.
She's killed a lot of SIS. Seems to me you need to hire some outside assistance.
Sounds like you need help.
This operation fails, hunter, I might just give you a call.
She wanted you to fight those girls on Dromund Kaas, Mako. Got what she wanted no matter who won.
She set us up.
That low-down, motherless rancor! I knew it was fishy, and I walked right into it! I am such an idiot!
You haven't given us a whole lot of reason to believe what you say.
Why should we trust you?
Believe what you like. I'm afraid I'm still out of time.
Mako, I'll contact you after my team's taken Coral into custody. We have a lot to talk about. Izak out.
I'm intercepting all his outgoing transmissions. Looks like... yes, I have the coordinates he's sending out.
Got to be where she's hiding.
Coral's location.
That's exactly what I was thinking.
You're doing real well at this, "waiting to hear back from Izak" stuff so far.
You're waiting patiently.
Did you hear me say, "Sure, Izak, I'll just sit here, twiddling my thumbs, until you call back!"?
I don't think you want to be more involved in this than you already are.
Bad idea.
Coral owes me answers, and I'm not going to get them unless I get to her first.
I've downloaded the coordinates to the nav computer. Let's go pay my sister a friendly visit.
Remember the guy Coral said was after her? Izak? The one we were supposed to stop on Dromund Kaas?
Target didn't show up. Hard to forget that.
I remember.
Everything else has sort of dead-ended, thought maybe I'd try to see what I could find on him.
Find something out?
What about him?
A little bit.
Don't remember an "Izak."
Not really.
Can't exactly blame you for that, since we never actually met him.
He's SIS, no surprise there. So there's not much to find.
Except for this: He's assigned to Project 32. The same project all my relatives seem to be associated with.
You got any idea what that means?
Meaning what?
I don't know yet. He's important, though, I can tell you that much.
You should head to one of Nar Shaddaa's casinos and play that number. Probably make some credits.
Your lucky number.
Right now I feel like maybe gambling isn't a great idea.
I think we could've guessed that.
No surprise there.
Yeah, it's not exactly a huge revelation.
Searching for his name tripped all kinds of security. So... don't be surprised if a lot of uniforms are looking for us.
I think I might take up a new hobby for a while. A safer one. Like nexu grooming.
Got a few minutes? Maybe you could give me a few pointers on my pistol technique?
Doesn't hurt to get some practice in.
Guess I can spare a minute.
Won't take long, I promise.
You've got the aim of a three-legged bantha.
About time you practiced.
It's a wonder you can put up with me, isn't it? Your patience is really the stuff of legend.
Guns and my favorite girl? Sign me up.
[Flirt] Love to.
You're so cute when you're thinking about shooting stuff.
So now is good?
My time is yours. Say the word.
Of course.
How about now?
Because actually, I just wanted to show off. I've got a new shot, and I can't wait for you to see it!
In fact, I'm sort of looking forward to seeing it in action, myself.
So, what do you think?
Ought to try it out on a real target, I think.
Let's put it to use.
Couldn't have suggested better myself.
You're getting pretty good.
Not bad.
Thanks!
Wasn't much of an improvement.
I've seen better.
Hey! Next time we see some action, I'll show you an improvement!
Let's move. I kind of want to shoot something now.
What is it they say about curiosity again? Does it involve lavish paid vacations? Maybe Trandoshani flatcakes?
So, I may have gone back into the SIS computers. Just a little.
Thought I told you not to waste time on that when we had real work?
Didn't I tell you to stop?
Okay, technically, maybe you said something like that. But it's really hard to verify.
Bad idea ticking off SIS for no reason.
You're asking for trouble.
I've got a reason! Most of a reason, anyway.
SIS probably won't mind at all, then. Seem like real understanding guys.
It's only a little, huh?
Sure. I mean, what could go wrong?
You wouldn't be telling me this if you didn't see something in there.
And you found something.
Am I that obvious? Have to work on that.
Remember how I said I found birth certificates for my family? A dozen of them?
Well, I found out that ten of them also have death certificates.
Sounds like SIS is doing some cleanup.
Probably not natural causes.
Cleanup. Like they were all dirt someone tracked in.
Guess that means there's nobody wondering why you don't call.
No family dinners, then.
You know, I'd even planned my excuse for missing holidays, too.
I know you got your hopes up. Wish it had turned out better.
I'm sorry.
I'll get over it. Not like I haven't got tons of orphan experience already.
I guess it's just me and Coral now.
Well, on that cheery note, let's move on, huh?
So, you want to hear the latest news from the holonet?
There's a lot of buzz about you. Apparently, you have a fan club now.
Unless they're offering me credits, I don't care.
Waste of time.
It's got to be the armor. They can't possibly admire you for your charm.
You've got to admit, they're on to something.
[Flirt] They got good taste.
They are. Admiring you from afar? Way better than being close enough to smell you.
If you got nothing else useful to say, let's move on.
We done?
Yes, sir.
I wouldn't mind having fans as pretty as you.
[Flirt] You joining the club?
If one of us was going to have fans, I'd think it would be you.
[Flirt] Smarter to admire you.
So you've had some time. Change your mind about us?
[Flirt] Think things over yet?
If you're one of them, I might just have to get closer to my fans.
[Flirt] You going to join it?
You're really cute, you know that?
Don't suppose you've changed your mind about things?
[Flirt] Rather hear about us.
What do you want me to say? I like you, but it's a bad idea.
It's not going to work. It's a small ship. Nowhere to go when things get ugly.
We're just not meant to be involved.
That's how we'll play it, then.
If that's what you want.
Just friends? End of story?
So that's it?
Strictly business. No matter how much you give me that... sort of melty look.
I don't care if we're meant to be. I still want you.
I'm not giving up.
There's that melty look again. I'm going to go back to work now.
Sorry, did you say something? I'm sort of... half here. Not feeling so good.
I keep seeing those dead girls... my sisters... And I feel... queasy. Anyway, sorry. Did you need something?
That's past. Don't let it get in the way of what you're doing.
Keep your head on straight.
Yeah, I know. Sorry.
You don't look so good.
You okay?
I'm fine. Just... really weirded out. Don't think that's a medical condition.
I'm here if you need me.
You want to talk about it?
Thanks. Can you cure a massive case of being freaked out?
I don't exactly know how to get over seeing myself--two of me--die.
And you know the worst part? Coral didn't tell me. Didn't say a word about other sisters.
You're slowing me down. Pull yourself together.
Get over it.
Right. Because nothing helps like kicking a girl when she's down. Thanks.
Definitely plenty of Makos around these days.
Seem to be a lot of you.
One identical sister was sorta neat. Three is weird. Trying to kill me? Creepy.
Coral has some explaining to do.
We need some answers.
No kidding. I'm getting answers out of somebody if it kills me. Or them. Preferably them.
Let's get moving before I get even more weirded out.
SIS should throw their ciphers a party! With clowns! And a juggling bantha.
Stupid datapad is impossible to decrypt. But! Not all is lost!
Found a holo address. For Coral. I think. I mean, it could be her. I sort of... wanted you around when I called her.
How could I pass this up? Go ahead when you're ready.
[Flirt] Wouldn't miss it.
Sure, because this will be fun. Sort of like flying into a black hole.
I've got your back, Mako. Call her.
I'm here for you.
What's the worst that can happen? It's not her. Or it is her, and she instantly hates me. Not a problem.
Get it over with so we can get back to work.
Just make it quick.
That's you, encouraging as always.
Nobody can shoot you in a holocall. What're you scared of?
You don't need me for that.
Right. Nothin' to worry about. Just a stupid call.
Hello?
Hi... Coral? It's Coral, right? I'm Mako.
Mother of--Mako? My little sister, Mako? I can't believe it! I thought... I thought you were dead! How did you find me?
Wasn't exactly easy... ran into an SIS guy looking for you.
Izak? The SIS agent, was his name Izak?
Name was Carteri.
Not Izak.
Don't know if it's weirder that you're being hunted by multiple agents, or that you know 'em all personally.
You know them by name?
Seems to me you better start explaining.
What trouble are you in?
Oh no! Mako, you've got to help me! Please!
If you're going to tell me SIS is after you? I already figured that out.
Carteri's just one of the agents after me. Izak's the one leading them. If he finds me...
What? What's he want you for?
I've got to go. I've been on this channel too long already.
He's on Dromund Kaas, looking for me right now. If there's anything you can do to stop him...
Wait, Coral, what's going on? Why is he after you?
They're already trying to trace my location! I have to go. Please! You're the only hope I've got!
What is it with people never answering my questions?
Got to be hiding something.
Suspicious.
That was weird, wasn't it? Wasn't just me, right?
You finally talked to your sister. What's your take on her?
So, what do you think?
She's... really like me, isn't she? I really have a sister.
She's your sister. We can look for Izak if you want. Your call.
Want to help her?
Let's go to Dromund Kaas.
Remember how I said I'd avoid SIS databases for the time being?
Decided this was a good time to take a crack at the encryption on that SIS creep Carteri's datapad.
The encryption is crazy! Someone threw a solid wall of credits into keeping this thing secure.
Anyone goes to that much trouble to keep a secret, it's got to be something serious.
Sounds like something big.
That's the scary part.
I need you focused on our target, Mako. Don't get sidetracked.
Don't waste time on it.
I'm not! I'm just fiddling around with it in my spare time.
SIS has deep pockets. Nothing newsworthy there.
You sound surprised.
The security on this datapad is tighter than anything I've seen. Even the classified stuff.
I mean, I'm seriously getting the creeps now.
What's my family involved in that's worth this kind of money to the Republic?
You're really upset about this.
This is really eating you.
I don't know if it's about my family, or Braden, or just a puzzle I can't solve. It's making me crazy.
Whatever it is, stay out of it. We don't need to borrow trouble.
Not our problem.
That's probably the smart approach.
Whatever they're hiding could be pretty messy.
You sure you want to know?
Whatever it is, I've got to find out.
Anyway, thanks for listening to me babble. Much appreciated.
Remember that SIS project number I found? 32?
Turns out, if you search for it in enough super-secret Republic databases, it gets noticed.
Ran into a little... trouble. Like, "If I keep doing this, the chance of mysteriously disappearing goes up dramatically" sort of trouble.
Doesn't sound so bad. You let that scare you off?
Is that all?
Thought I'd ask you to test it. Maybe the billion or so agents they'll send just hand out free candy!
No point risking your neck if there's no money in it.
Call it quits.
Well, I'm not poking around the SIS data for a while, anyway.
Anything happens to you, I don't know what I'll do.
[Flirt] Be careful.
You just know you can't find another slicer who'll put up with you.
I know you want to find out where you're from, but It's not doing Braden's memory any favors if you die.
Don't get yourself killed.
I'm actively working on the "not dying" thing, no worries.
Figure there are other, less... hazardous channels I can look into.
I'll... ah... let you know if I decide to do anything stupid. Or more likely, let you know after.
Been running some diagnostics on the ship. Hyperdrive seems to need a little TLC.
We ought to get it looked at. What's worse than a neglected hyperdrive?
Don't want it breaking down on us. I'll deal with it.
Thanks for the warning.
Nothing else to report. Should we get back to work?
Let's get moving.
Yeah.
You got it.
Talk to me. Haven't heard much from you lately.
[Flirt] What's the rush?
We covered the ship, now what's your status?
[Flirt] How're you doing?
I'm okay. Better, now the Great Hunt's over. Could use a chance to unwind, though.
You could probably use some TLC, too.
[Flirt] A neglected Mako?
All work and no play makes for a dull slicer. I wouldn't exactly say no to a vacation.
Might be time to take a break from business. Go get some R&R.
[Flirt] All work and no play.
Taking a break sounds good. What did you have in mind?
We might have to make some plans. I'll let you know.
I'll think about it.
You planning a vacation... this should be something to see.
We should go somewhere, just you and me.
[Flirt] We should get away.
Look, I like you. You're fun. And you look good in durasteel. But it's a really bad idea for us to get involved.
Never mix business and pleasure, you know? Leads to trouble.
I suppose you've got a point, there.
You might be right.
If that's settled, let's get back to work, huh?
A little trouble might be fun.
[Flirt] Could be worth it.
Don't hold your breath, big guy.
We can talk about it later.
[Flirt] Think about it.
Right. Let's get back to work, okay?
Could show you some fun right here, if you want.
[Flirt] Back of the ship?
Smooth. Real smooth. But I'm pretty sure you couldn't.
You know, SIS computers? Way easier to slice than I thought. Which is sort of worrying, now that I think about it.
Did some poking around in a few classified Republic databases. Found my birth certificate! Well, maybe.
Found a dozen birth certificates, all with a gene stamp a lot like mine.
A dozen is a lot of targets. Doesn't tell us where to start looking.
Not real precise.
Well, no. It doesn't. But it's still a great find.
I followed you up to "poking." Everything after that coulda been in Huttese.
You want to say that in Basic?
There a point to this?
So?
Cool your hyperdrive, I'm getting to the good stuff.
My family's records! It's got to be! Parents, siblings, maybe grandparents, who knows what else?
No names or dates, though. Just an SIS project number: 32. Have to keep looking, see what else I can find.
That guy, Carteri from Nar Shaddaa? Remember him? Doesn't exist.
We met him so he's real. Fake identity?
Pretty sure he does.
I dunno. I'm not sure he wasn't a holo. Or maybe a bunch of mynocks in a human-suit.
The guy was too much of a wuss to be important. Probably can't lead you to anything useful.
Carteri's a false lead.
But the guy is... invisible or something.
Figured he'd get in front of a blaster sooner or later.
He turn up dead?
No, no. He's not dead. Not far as I know, anyway.
I can't find out anything about him. Nothing!
You already thought he was SIS.
Can't find a spy.
Yeah, but he was such a wimp, I sort of threw that theory out.
This isn't important, Mako.
You're wasting time.
Kinda important to me!
If there's any intel on this guy at all, you'll find it.
Something'll turn up.
I hope you're right.
Trying a little hard to dig up intel on a guy we left in the dust, aren't you?
[Flirt] Why so interested?
You jealous? Of a guy who squealed at the first sign of a blaster? Today just keeps getting better.
You know what's weird? More I look at that holo of Coral... more it makes me think.
If I've got a sister, what else've I got? Aunts? Uncles? Cousins? Maybe I've been missing family dinners my whole life.
All that stuff just gets in the way of business.
You don't need that.
Yeah, probably right on that.
You find your long-lost family, next thing you know, they're hitting you up for a loan.
They'll just ask for money.
Or asking me to do the dishes. Guess I'm better off.
Could be a bunch of people wondering where you are right now.
Maybe they missed you, too.
Think so? Probably all torqued at me. "That Mako! She never calls! She never writes!"
Still, I've got to wonder... how're they connected to SIS? Something I need to figure out.
That new armor?
I like it. Makes your arms look bigger. Not that they needed it.
We've got work to do. Focus on that.
My armor's not important.
Sometimes I forget that you were raised by mynocks and never learned to carry a conversation.
A guy's got to make an impression. Nothing can be small.
[Flirt] I'm a big guy.
Except your ego. That's pretty dainty.
Got more than just armor I could show you.
[Flirt] You checking me out?
Really? Because I have been curious about the targeting system for your rocket launcher....
How do you manage to make durasteel look good? If I wore that, people'd think I strapped on a shipping crate.
I don't have time to talk about armor.
We've got work to do.
Sorry, I forgot you were allergic to friendly conversation. Wouldn't want you to break out in hives.
Wearing this stuff drives men crazy. You need a flamethrower to keep them away.
Guys love a girl in durasteel.
I dunno... they probably like the flamethrower, too. I've seen the way they look at it.
You're so skinny, you could probably make that work.
You could pull it off.
More likely, I'd get loaded into a cargo compartment and smuggled to Corellia.
Anyway, we've got things to do, people to hunt.
Been talking to some people.
One of my contacts just had some guy on Nar Shaddaa asking about me.
Exactly what's he want to know about you?
Asking what?
Sounds like he's asking to get shot.
Could be trouble.
Hear any objections? Me neither.
Probably one of these in every spaceport. You should learn to let 'em down easy.
Ex-boyfriend?
Cute. Real cute. No, not anyone I know.
My contact says the guy practically screams "spook." He's asking about my "whereabouts."
Goes by the name of Carteri. The spook, not my contact. I think we have time to pay him a visit, don't you?
I'm not leaving him loose to come after us. We'll deal with him soon.
We better.
Let's look him up, find out who sent him.
I want to meet this guy.
All right. Then we have a plan.
If we're in the neighborhood, maybe.
Might get around to it.
I'll be holding my breath.
Mandalorians really weren't kidding about wanting Jicoln Cadera out of the way.
There's all kinds of celebrating going on. Least I think that's what they're doing.
Sort of hard to tell celebrating Mandalorians from angry ones.
I don't need to know about Mandalorian moods.
There a point to this?
Excuse me for telling you what people say about you.
If someone's gettin' shot, they're angry.
Here's a hint.
I'll keep that in mind for next time we meet Mandalore.
Doesn't hurt to stay on their good side.
Glad they're happy.
Entire Imperial military went nuts over Admiral Ivernus' death.
So much backstabbing's going on, whoever finally gets his post'll have to be made of durasteel.
Those Imperials want some of their rivals taken out, I could oblige.
Any bounties posted?
I'll check into it. Got to be someone in the market for a hunter.
Imperial officers need a few people trying to kill them. Keeps them on their toes.
It's good practice.
In that case, whoever gets the job will be super qualified.
Makes no difference to me if they all die.
So?
There you go again, being all friendly and optimistic. Sort of sickening, really.
Remember Lord Dak-ah?
The Altacas announced his triumphant return home from harrowing captivity.
He's already being asked to travel and talk about it.
Seems to me I should have a share of the credits for that.
Ought to get a cut.
Good point! I'll see if I can't get in touch with his people.
Wonder exactly how much he'll tell about his little "adventure."
Might be worth a laugh.
Might have to pick up a recording and find out.
The guy's smart, using this to make some credits.
Good for him.
Guy's got business sense, anyway.
Or rather, Lady Dak-ah? I found this posting... no names on it, but it sounds like her.
Think she's in the market for a new... toy. Gross.
Aren't enough credits in the galaxy to get me to take that job.
No money is enough for that.
You said it!
She find someone to take his place?
Any takers?
Didn't look that far into it. Tell you the truth, I... don't want to know.
Might be interested in that.
How much is she offering?
Nothing I can say to that except: Eww.
So... been sort of wondering what kind of people put classified government doodads in their kids' heads.
Figured there had to be something in the official records I could dig up.
Don't suppose you found something worth some credits?
Get anything useful?
I wish.
You found them?
Do I look like I care about your implant?
Why are you telling me this?
If I can put up with your smell, you can listen to me ramble once in a while.
Nothing came up in official channels. Means I probably wasn't born on the Smuggler's Moon.
But I figure, someone on Nar Shaddaa's got to remember them, right? Just have to keep asking.
Lots of people go through the Smugglers' Moon and nobody notices. Might be a waste of time.
Doesn't narrow much down.
I know, but I've got to try anyway.
You must have some notion who they were.
Got a theory?
No. But I like to imagine they're smugglers. Tragically shot down hauling a cargo of illegal gizkas.
You're the best slicer in the sector. You'll find something.
Keep looking.
Thanks! I'll keep you posted.
Word spreads fast. Whole HoloNet's in shock about what happened.
Bloodworthy dead, Defenestrator dead... no one can believe it.
No one's shedding any tears for Jewl'a Nightbringer, though.
Sooner I get my hands on that Jedi, the better.
We'll deliver their payback.
We'll find him.
You never had to worry about her.
[Flirt] Still jealous?
Don't know. I was pretty sure she could kill people with her breath.
She was never my favorite person exactly.
I can't say I miss her either.
I assume she killed her targets with her personality.
I keep expecting Bloodworthy to call and say this was just more hazing.
I can't believe it either.
Yeah. Just when we join ranks with living legends the list gets dramatically shortened. Not what I was expecting, really.
Death of the Durasteel Duke is the biggest news on the holonet.
Nobody's more surprised than the people of Alderaan. A lot of lords and ladies throwing around accusations about who's responsible.
I'll bet a bunch were just stunned that he turned out to be real.
Nobody pays you to kill boogeymen.
I don't hunt stories.
Could look into it, though. Might be good business hunting ghosts.
How impressed are you to be working with a legend?
[Flirt] Guess I'm a big deal.
I'm awestruck. Wonder how I haven't fainted from sheer excitement?
Not much of a fairy tale ending. Shouldn't I get a handsome prince, or something?
Shame it was all too real.
Hey, a baron isn't bad. You don't see me with any noble suitors.
Good question! Pretty sure we're owed at least one prince. Maybe more.
Barely even put up a fight.
He wasn't anything special.
Well, he was dead at the time. Still, imagine the reaction you'd get if anyone knew the truth.
Been poking around the holonet. Heard a few things that seem suspicious.
A Jedi, two Imperial colonels, and a Hutt came down with bad cases of dead within hours of each other.
Had to be Great Hunt targets.
Think they were Blood's targets? He ahead of me now?
Taro Blood's work?
Too hard to say. Blood's not the only one we're up against.
Doesn't matter what the other hunters are doing. Stick with me and we'll win this for Braden.
[Flirt] Don't worry.
Too bad we can't bottle that crazy optimism of yours. We'd make a fortune.
We've got this thing in the bag, Mako. We'll do Braden proud.
We'll catch up.
That's what I like about you. You're crazy. Inspiring, but crazy.
Tell me something I need to know.
Do I look like I care?
Don't mind me. I'm just here, warning you that you might suck at this competition, is all.
So, looked up the manufacturer of my implant. Weird stuff.
Exclusively government contractor. Everything on this model is classified.
Tells you something, anyway. Must've had connections.
Probably expensive.
Seems that way.
Guess your parents had plans for you. Maybe following in their footsteps.
They wanted you in SIS maybe.
You think they were SIS?
Want to translate that into basic for me?
What's that mean?
Whoever my parents were, they got their hands on one mother of a top-secret gadget.
Don't know what that means yet, but I intend to find out.
Seriously, nobody on the entire HoloNet has anything better to do than gossip about you?
At first, some of it was true, but now they're just trying to outdo each other with crazy stories.
Last I heard, you weren't a four-hundred-year-old Wookiee Jedi Master.
Doesn't matter one way or another what they say.
Let them talk.
You can be all stoic, good for you. It's my job to actually listen to this junk, though.
There's a lot you don't know about me. Maybe I'm in disguise.
Are you sure?
That explains so much!
Anyone who calls me a furball is in for a lot of hurt.
They called me a wookiee?
You realize you can't track down every idiot on the 'net, right? Not if you ever want to do anything else with your life.
Mandalorian Killer is about the only thing anyone talks about on the 'net these days.
Got the Mandalorians completely divided on this, you know.
One camp wants to declare this a holiday. Other is miffed they didn't get to kill him.
If they wanted the kill, they should've been faster on the draw.
They had their chance.
Want to tell them that? Pretty sure they'll take it well.
I thought you'd know by now that nobody on the 'net ever agrees about anything.
Are you surprised by that?
Got a point there.
Should I be watching for angry Mandalorians now?
Are they coming after me?
Pretty sure it's a load of bantha dung. Mandalorians really wanted you dead, it wouldn't be on the 'net.
So, this is pretty priceless: There's a ton of buzz on the 'net about "someone" breaking into Fa'athra's place.
Fa'athra has been throwing credits around to find out who did it. No takers.
Nem'ro is paying them to keep quiet. He's having way too much fun watching Fa'athra suffer.
Holonet comin' up with any other info?
Pick up anything else?
Republic politics. Rumors about the war. Nothing worth mentioning.
I didn't think there was anyone on Hutta who wouldn't sell their own mother for a quick credit.
That can't be cheap.
You'd think that'd be bigger news: "Beings with sense of humor located on Hutta! End of universe imminent!"
Nice to be able to keep tabs on things.
That's good to know.
You know, Braden used to say I was unique for having this HoloNet link. But I've no clue how I got it.
I've had this implant forever. Parents must have had me teched-out as a baby. Who does that?
It gets the job done.
Whatever works.
Oh, no question. Still, you know, most people have to get their own implants.
Maybe they were thinking about your future.
Planning ahead, I guess.
That's hard to imagine. The parents who abandoned me, thinking about my future?
I suppose that's a good question.
Beats me.
Braden was always encouraging me to look for my past. I figured, street kid from Nar Shaddaa -- what's to know?
Now... gotta admit, he was right. Something weird there.
I need you to focus on what we're doing, Mako.
Don't get distracted.
Man, you're a great motivator. Gonna stand over me, cracking a whip?
Digging around might turn up something useful.
Look into it.
Maybe I will.
You want any help, let me know.
[Flirt] Anything I can do?
Be careful about promises, buddy, or you'll wind up volunteering to wrestle rancors on Hutta.
Least you can do for the old man is honor his wishes. See what you can find out.
Do this for Braden.
You're right. I owe this to Braden. I'll check into it.
Thanks. Really. I appreciate it.
You know, things have gotten weird. I think... this was a bad idea. You and me, I mean.
Shouldn't have messed with something that worked, you know?
Don't have time to deal with second thoughts right now.
Not now, Mako.
This was definitely a bad idea.
Nothing is weird. We're fine.
You worry too much.
You think so? I hope you're right.
Things have been a little rocky, but they'll get better.
Don't say that.
You're right. Could just be over-reacting.
Forget I said anything. I'm already starting to feel stupid about freaking out over nothing.
You know, I really am an idiot.
I don't know what I was thinking, letting myself fall for a dumb thug!
No point trying to talk about anything when you're this angry.
Calm down.
I suppose all the shouting just makes me look like an even bigger idiot.
Might help if I knew why you were upset.
Want to tell me what I did?
See, I don't know if I should be glad you care, or upset that you don't know.
I... have some thinking to do, I guess.
Don't know why you think I'm interested in listening to you complain.
Yeah, you're an idiot.
Right. Thanks for confirming that "dumb thug" thing for me.
Okay, I've got to ask: What are you thinking lately?
Because I can't tell if there's a brain in your head or just another blaster. You're all, "shoot first and ask questions later."
I'm a bounty hunter. I'm not getting paid to chat.
I'm doing my job.
I know what we do. Just like to think that we're not running around shooting everything that moves.
You looking for an apology? Should I ask your permission before I take out a target?
What do you want me to do?
I want to know that you think about what you're doing.
Like, once a week, maybe. Wouldn't want you to strain anything.
You don't have to yell at me. I know I've screwed up lately.
I've made some bad calls.
I shouldn't have said anything. You've got this covered.
This didn't work out. I know it, you know it.
It's time to call it quits.
No reason to let this ruin our business.
We can still work together.
Yeah, wouldn't want anything to endanger your precious work.
I didn't want this to happen.
I'm sorry.
I know. Me neither.
Was wondering how long I'd have to put up with your whining.
Finally.
And that's why this was a good call. Thanks a lot, big guy.
You never lose a wink of sleep over anything, do you? You could kick babies and still feel fine!
Man, being a sociopath really does have its privileges, doesn't it?
You got something to say, say it. Otherwise, get back to work.
Your point is?
No. I've got nothing to say to you.
I start letting jobs eat at me, I'm not going to last long in this business, Mako.
I can't let work get to me.
I know you've got to do your job, but does that mean turning into a mindless killer?
Sure, bounty hunters do some nasty stuff, but you're still a human being, right?
I like to think we're better than just hired thugs. Helps me sleep at night.
I guess you aren't troubled by little things like a conscience, though. Lucky you.
Lots of what I do gets to me. I just don't go around talking about it.
I don't feel fine.
Sometimes you scare me. Can't read your mind, you know?
I'm here if you want to talk, you know? Keep me in the loop.
I can't believe I was so stupid! Such a naive little idiot!
We don't have time for this. Save it for later.
Not now, Mako.
Tough. You're going to hear it now.
You want to tell me what's got you so upset?
What's the matter?
Tell me something I don't know.
I could've told you that.
What you don't know could fill a quadrant.
Here's a laugh-- I actually thought all bounty hunters were men of honor, like Braden.
But I was wrong. You? You're just a thug.
If you've said what you have to say, get back to work.
Noted.
Sure thing, boss.
Exactly what does that make you, then?
And you work for a thug.
An idiot.
I've made some mistakes, but I'm trying to hang on to my honor.
You weren't wrong.
No offense, but I'm not holding my breath waiting for you to do right.
We'll talk later, okay?
Let's talk back at the ship.
This is a bad time. We'll talk when it's safer.
Hey, about earlier? Thanks.
Torian's a great guy! I think it it might actually work out.
Just don't get all lovesick on me.
Don't lose your head.
I'll go practice making puppy eyes somewhere else, then. Thanks again!
That's what I'm here for. And if he breaks your heart, I'll shoot him.
No problem.
You're the best.
Don't hurt him, or I'll probably have to shoot you.
Be good to him.
Got it. Thanks again.
Thanks for your advice earlier. About Torian, I mean.
It probably wouldn't have worked out.
So... that basically didn't work.
I like Torian, but I don't think I get him.
You work together. Better this way.
It's for the best.
Yeah. It would've gotten weird and messy anyhow.
Wish it'd been different.
I'm sorry.
Well, there's no shortage of good-looking Mandalorians out there. Maybe next time.
I don't think you guys were right for each other.
He's just not your type.
You're probably right.
You can actually cook? You?
Of course.
I can't imagine you in a kitchen.
Hardly ever been in a kitchen. Mostly cook in the field.
What are you standing around for? Go.
Back to work, you two.
Sorry.
Slave driver.
Gotta be ready with proof, if you're going to make claims like that, Torian.
You should make her something.
Good idea. Tiingilar?
What's that?
Guess you'll find out.
I won't interrupt. Just passing through.
Don't mind me.
Enough chit-chat. We've both got stuff to do.
Guess so.
Are you busy? Maybe you could help me work on my shot?
Love to.
So, Torian... he's kind of cute, don't you think?
Good aim, solid tracker.
He's a good shot.
Way to miss the point of the question.
I don't mind looking at him, that's for sure.
Definitely easy on the eyes.
So, you think maybe he's your type, then?
He's okay, I guess. Sort of like a tame kath hound.
He's too docile.
You don't like him?
I don't mix business and pleasure.
We just work together.
He's good-looking and Mandalorian. What's not to like?
I might be interested.
Well, you should say something to him, then! What are you waiting for?
I might get around to it.
Maybe I will.
Right. I'm holding my breath.
He's not exactly screaming encouragements.
He doesn't seem to like me.
You think he's interested?
Think I should?
You should see how he looks at you. Quit torturing the boy and go talk to him.
We don't get along as well as you might think.
We didn't work out.
Ouch, sorry. Maybe I shouldn't have said anything.
He's just not what I'm looking for.
He's not my type.
Because I sort of... think I like him.
I think he's interested in me, but... he's really good at the "Mandalorian" thing. It's hard to tell what he's thinking.
It's a bad idea, Mako. Never date people you work with.
Don't get involved.
You're right. I should know better. I do know better!
It's his arms, they're just so-- I shouldn't have let them get to me.
He definitely looks at you. Go talk to him.
I think he likes you.
Really? I will! Thanks! You're the best!
I don't think he's interested.
He's not into you.
Yeah, you're probably right.
You need something?
I'm a slicer, not a psychic. What's on your mind?
This job never gets any easier, does it?
Let's keep going, yeah?
What do you want?
Not a bad bit of work, if I do say so myself.
We're a great team!
I'm following your lead.
Well, now what do we do?
Ready when you are.
Following your lead, as always.
Will do.
No sweat.
Right! Let's do this!
Right-o.
We could use some R & R, that is for sure.
Time to find out who's standing between us and a week on the beach.
Just doing my job.
Right behind you.
So how do you want to spend the credits?
